Name: Small pottery jug
Description: Footed beaker, made on the potter's wheel, with single applied handle, globular body widest toward the base, and narrow neck flaring to wide mouth. The rilling marks from throwing on the wheel are clear around both body and neck. The vessel was acquired by Lady Harriet Kavanagh at Thebes in the 1840s: it may possibly derive from a late Roman burial or monastic site.
